study_abroad_basics.question: What is the general process of studying abroad?
study_abroad_basics.answer: The process typically involves: 1) Choosing a country and program 2) Meeting language requirements 3) Preparing and submitting applications 4) Securing funding/scholarships 5) Obtaining a student visa 6) Planning accommodation

study_abroad_basics.question: How much does studying abroad typically cost?
study_abroad_basics.answer: Costs vary significantly by country and program. Average annual expenses including tuition and living costs: US/UK: $35,000-70,000, Germany: €10,000-20,000, Canada: CAD 30,000-50,000, Australia: AUD 30,000-45,000

visa_information.question: What are the common student visa requirements?
visa_information.answer: Common requirements include: 1) Acceptance letter from university 2) Proof of sufficient funds 3) Valid passport 4) Language proficiency test scores 5) Health insurance 6) Clean background check

accommodation.question: What are the housing options for international students?
accommodation.answer: Common options include: 1) University dormitories 2) Private student housing 3) Shared apartments 4) Homestays. On-campus housing typically ranges from $5,000-15,000 per academic year.

custom_entries.question: Why study Abroad ?
custom_entries.answer: Studying abroad opens doors to global opportunities, diverse cultures, world-class education, and personal growth — all while building an international network for your future career.

english_speaking_countries.question: What are the English language requirements?
english_speaking_countries.answer: IELTS: Usually 6.0-7.0 for undergraduate, 6.5-7.5 for postgraduate. TOEFL: 80-100 for undergraduate, 90-110 for postgraduate. Some universities may accept Duolingo English Test.

non_english_countries.question: Do I need to know the local language?
non_english_countries.answer: Germany: German B1/B2 for German-taught programs. France: DELF B2 for French programs. Many countries offer English-taught programs requiring no local language proficiency.

global_opportunities.question: What are the major international scholarships available?
global_opportunities.answer: Major scholarships include: Fulbright Scholarships, Chevening Scholarships (UK), DAAD Scholarships (Germany), Erasmus Mundus Scholarships (EU), Commonwealth Scholarships

country_specific.question: What country-specific scholarships are available?
country_specific.answer: US: Fulbright, EducationUSA. UK: British Council Scholarships. Germany: DAAD. Canada: Vanier CGS. Australia: Australia Awards. Each typically covers tuition and living expenses.

post_study_work.question: What are the post-study work opportunities?
post_study_work.answer: US: OPT up to 3 years. UK: Graduate Route 2 years. Canada: PGWP up to 3 years. Australia: Post-study work visa 2-4 years. Germany: 18 months job-seeker visa.

job_markets.question: Which fields have the best job prospects?
job_markets.answer: High-demand fields: IT/Computer Science, Data Science, Healthcare, Engineering, Business Analytics, Renewable Energy, Artificial Intelligence. Average starting salaries vary by country and field.
